title: Will iPhone XS max work on 5G? - Quora

response.answer_text: Apple will not likely offer 5G support until it becomes beneficial to do so. Things that must happen for this to be beneficial to Apple: Wide adoption of the cellular standard, so that users can actually use it.Radio chip that integrates 5G radios with LTE radios. Apple has always waited for a power efficient solution to the latest cell technology, only implementing after a unified radio chip is availableActual perceived and realized benefit to the consumer5G is not really a thing yet. Phones that report being in a 5G network, are trying to fool you. Almost every 5G network is actually an LTE network, but the carrier changed the branding on your phone to say 5G. AT&T did this same thing with 4G — before LTE was available on their network, they decided the high speed 3G network was like 4G speed wise, and branded their HSDPA 3G network (an actual 3G standard) as 4G. And the shocker is the ITU allowed it, knowing full well it was not 4G. They later built out an LTE network (which still is not 4G, it is a sub-standard of 4G that enables the slow evolution to 4G) we never achieved true 4G, and now we are being sold in 5G. Don’t believe the hype. response.answer_text: No.5G’s arrival (approaching 1Gbps) coincides with Wi-Fi 6, optical LANs, digital remote powering, smart buildings & Edge-computing. People pay extra money to EXPERIENCE the Cutting Edge tech 1st & make future planning ahead of followers like Apple. The exciting new Galaxy S10 5G with 6.7″ best screen, squeezes extra 4-camera setup, delivering 3D capabilities, including video portrait effects.For those advanced experiences, the iPhone XS max users will have to move elsewhere. There will be tens of flagship phones that will offer better features before Apple wakes up. Good luck.

It doesn’t matter, but it won’t, 5G is a state of the art tecnology in early stages of deployment, so unless you live in one of few markets that had it, or would have it in the near future, you have the money and don’t mind paying extra for service and, this is important, you won’t go anywhere else for at least a couple of years or you end up using LTE anyway, doesn’t matter if you device, no matter the brand, have 5G capabilities, it’s not always the best approach to be the first for many reasons, being the main one here that the chipset would add to the devices price without real gain in terms of connectivity for the end user in markets without 5G, due this to the limited deployment of that technology, because of course you still have to keep the chips for older technologies, that’s why you won’t find an Apple product with the latest connectivity chip, maybe in 2020 or 2021 when the deployment of 5G is mature enough at least here in the US, which would make more sense to fully adopt 5G by then

Thanks for the A2A. No, the iPhone Xs Max will not work on 5G. No iPhone Apple has ever made — including all current models as of 12/9/19 — will work on 5G. They lack the hardware that would make it possible for them to connect to a 5G network. Apple has publicly stated their first 5G capable iPhones will be released in the fall of 2020.

No it will not. This is because it does not have the required network chip. And because Apple is stubborn and doesn’t want to use Qualcomm it will likely be much longer than Android phones get 5G. So no, the XS Max can’t use 5G even if some ISP’s say so, it’s physically impossible.

As of 10/12/2019 no iPhone has a 5G modem, as do most other phones also do not have a 5G modem. Without a 5G modem a device can not use 5g. These devices will continue to work and work fine just as they are but just not on 5G. They will continue to work on 4G and 3G networks. There is a handful of actual devices with a 5G modem that can use the 5G network now, many more to come next year.
No, no phone will work without the 5G hardware module. And 5G is far from implemented throughout the US, and likely won’t be for quite some time. Don’t hold your breath!
